name: Bondcliff

trails_config.name: Lincoln Woods Trail to Bondcliff
trails_config.description: A legendary trek to one of the Whites’ most iconic viewpoints. Follow the flat Lincoln Woods Trail and Wilderness Trail deep into the Pemigewasset, then ascend the Bondcliff Trail as it steepens and breaks treeline at Bondcliff’s dramatic cliffs. The summit offers an unparalleled sense of exposure and grandeur. Many consider this one of the finest hikes in New England, often undertaken as part of a Bonds traverse or multi-day backpack.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Bondcliff. At 4265 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4265 feet, Bondcliff is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Lincoln Woods Trail to Bondcliff**, a **18.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **West Bond**, which is just 1.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
